id: Defense Chiefs Seek Friendlier Skies Over Asia’s Military Flashpoints
paragraph: November 17, 2018SINGAPORE—Eighteen nations including the U.S. and China agreed in principle Saturday to sign up to guidelines governing potentially dangerous encounters by military aircraft, a step toward stabilizing flashpoints but one that leaves enough wiggle room to ignore the new standards when a country wants.The guidelines essentially broaden a similar agreement reached by the U.S. and China three years ago and are an attempt to mitigate against incidents and collisions in some of the world’s most tense areas.WSJ MembershipCustomer ServiceTools & FeaturesAdsMore
